snippet: Dummy tags on counterfeit products like UGG boots were hidden when they were imported, federal prosecutors charged.
abstract: Federal agents arrest 29 people, most of them Chinese, in the breakup of two overlapping criminal rings planning to sell $325 million worth of counterfeit goods throughout the United States; counterfeit goods were smuggled into New Jersey warehouses from China and then shipped to sellers across the country.
lead_paragraph: Dummy tags on counterfeit products like UGG boots were hidden when they were imported, federal prosecutors charged.

headline.seo: Officials Say They Smashed a Ring Smuggling Counterfeit UGGs
headline.main: Officials Tell of Fake Labels Hidden Beneath Fake Labels
headline.print_headline: Officials Tell of Fake Labels Hidden Beneath Fake Labels
